content: This topic can be used for anything about or during Connectathon 25. See you soon!

I am planning to verify the VXU to FHIR transformations, with a primary goal of creating a large number of JSON and XML artifacts that are community might use for creating demonstration systems for supporting FHIR. This fall/autumn we have a student project that is going to demonstrate how the Immunization community might move from HL7 v2 to FHIR. This project is going to convert a "reference implementation" that supports HL7 v2 into FHIR. I am going to use resources from this v2-to-fhir project to give examples the students can use. I'll use the time here at the Connectathon to prepare these messages and give feedback. I'm looking forward to working with all of you!
@Hans Buitendijk is there a meeting right now? I am lost on where to go?

Yep, but just regular zoom as we did not get it on Whova. Join Zoom Meeting - https://zoom.us/j/5100467805 | Meeting ID: 510 046 7805 | +1 929-436-2866-US (New York) | Find your local number: https://zoom.us/u/acrJHLNHol
If anybody would like to show their mappings/progress in more detail sometime Thursday or Friday on a particular time, or during one of our dedicated meetings, let me know so we can schedule/balance.
Some challenges with Zoom to get it up. Will be on shortly.
All sorted out. Zoom is up and running. We're starting with overview at 10am ET.

We will have the following meetings so far scheduled:
Thursday - 12:30-1:30pm ET to discuss CWE Mapping challenges
Thursday - 5-6pm ET standup to review progress, issues, next steps
Friday - 10-11am ET Review of mapping tool status using the maps and their learnings/challenges with the latest maps (Google and Microsoft)
Friday - 5-6pm ET wrap-up standup.

We are finalizing time on 15 min connectathon highlights. Aiming for Friday 12:00-12:15pm ET. Stay tuned.

If you have any other specific topics or updates to share, let us know.

Hello all, I am new to the community and the connectathon. I've been building a FHIR API/facade for our product, which traditionally consumes HL7 v2. I would like to vet my API to ensure that it is useful to a potential app developer and implements FHIR "correctly" - any recommendations on where to look and/or who to talk to?

For the record, I built my API using James Agnew's excellent HAPI library. It is currently supporting a simple set of R4 resources (Patient, ImagingStudy, DiagnosticReport, ServiceRequest..etc) for read-only consumption, plus simple search operations.

Thanks in advance!

Two documents reviewed during the CWE Mapping discussion. These will be further discussed during the conference calls.
CWE Mapping Discussion

Don't seem to have access o the Collaboration Spreadsheet
@Mohannad Hussain : Are you taking v2 messages as input to convert to FHIR? Or are you just focusing on the FHIR APIs being accessed by FHIR based Apps/b2b, i.e., straight FHIR use cases?

@Hans Buitendijk For the purpose of this Connectathon, I'd like to focus on the latter (APIs for FHIR based apps/b2b - FHIR use cases). Doing v2 to FHIR mapping is interesting but perhaps I could tackle that in Connectathon 26 :)
@Ranvijay Kumar : Try again. Fixed the Share settings.
Working now. Thanks
Just had a power outage. Back on, so Whova/Zoom should be back as well (if it dropped).

Tried to use Confluence table and that actually works quite nice to easily add comments, etc. Will check it later to see which one to use going forward. https://confluence.hl7.org/display/OO/CWE+Mapping+Guidance
We are in the BReakout room.
@Sajjad Hussain : Can you hear us in the room?
@Ranvijay Kumar : Don't see you in the breakout yet.
@Hans Buitendijk : Is it ok, if we share presentation slides, presented during "V2 to FHIR Connectathon Track - Tooling Reviews Breakout" session here?
Google: Cloud Healthcare Data Harmonization - HL7v2 to FHIR Mapping

During the Microsoft FHIR Converter Demo, there was a VSCode Extension shown. Is that currently available for the public?
@Ranvijay Kumar

It is currently not available to public. However, if you are a part of Microsoft Early Access Program, we can give you access to it. We expect it to be available to public in the next couple of months
@Larry Shields they have a gui version on their github that is open source
thanks, looking forward to the extension.
